review: My husband and I went here with our 4 month old baby last minute. The hostess was friendly and put us in a nice area with great space for the stroller . Food was good , no complaints. Would dine here again with Baby. The Brownie obsession dessert is amazing !!!

Ordered by phone a head of time for a simple order of original wings. Was told should be ready in 10-15 mins. BUT I waited for more than 30 mins in the restaurant after my order was taken 30 mins ago.  All waitresses n waiters were scattered around at bar, corners n a couple of tables and chatting?! Joking without taking care of customers. Whoa!  I had to go up to them to ask where my order was n when  it could be ready. Then one waiter went in the kitchen, the second waitress again n the third waiter again.  Only the last one came out said:"They made my order wrong so they were making it now. Should be ready in a few mins."  Speechless!!! I finally got my order from the first waiter who went into kitchen handed the wings and a little card said next appetizer for FREE.  I still want to be honest though. Thank you.

So sad. I used to like chain restaurant places especially when I was in college or single. Drinks were usually good and food was good for the price. TGIF tries to do both but this particular location is not good. The pick 4 apps we got were just ok. We picked the buffalo wings,  mozzarella sticks,  pretzel bread with dipping sauces,  and potato skins. The potato skins were the worst. Nearly no bacon and they chintzed on the portions. They pretty much used one potato skin and cut it into four pieces. Say what?!  The buffalo wings were not spicy at all and looked greasy. The best two were the pretzel bread and mozzarella sticks. The bread was soft and warm. The portion was large enough to share with four adults (two sticks). The mozzarella sticks were fried just right and came with more sticks than the potato skin, think there were four.  Onto the entrées. The kids meal was the best value. They get one entrée and one side. Plenty for the younger set. And a choice of fountain soda,  iced tea,  or milk at no extra charge. $1.49 extra if you wanted a slush instead.  The adults I were with mostly ordered burgers and french dip sandwiches. Not impressed. I ordered a side of mashed potatoes in lieu of french fries. That was not even served with sour cream. A note about the staff, I only saw my waitress three times. First to get our drink order, then our lunch order, and then for the check. Argh. Couldn't ask for napkins,  refills or sour cream. Miffed.  The chain places are great for fast food and hanging out but I was disappointed overall.

This place is much bigger than if looks from the outside. The wait time is very short and they even have a separate family area, with wide spacing between tables for strollers and high chairs, for the benefit of tables with children and diners who want to stay away from tables with children alike.   The food is great, as is the standard at all TGI Fridays, and the staff was very attentive to our needs.

One reason. The one main reason i go here  is because of the appetizers. The boneless wings are so good! Plus currently its $10 all you can eat apps! They're the main reason why I go. My favorite is the Sriracha ones. Not too spicy at all. I love them and i'm not a "spicy" person. Really good with the bleu cheese or ranch dips. The meat is so tender and moist. It can't get much better. Otherwise, the food is average. The mozzarella sticks are a good quality. They're seasoned fries are good too. The sliders on the appetizer menu have always been okay though last time the buns were old and i couldn't bite through them. The meat and seasonings were good though. The staff has always been alright. Never a problem. Very unenthusiastic. The manager is always around and seems to always be on top of things. Ill be back soon for wings

Service is horrific it took 9 minutes for us to get 2 comes .. Then we order spinach dip  that took 25 Minutes to come out within this 25 minutes our waitress went missing , I had to ask another waitress for help .. Lunch was horrible the shrimp was gross and tasted funny like they sat out for days !!! Never again

Well Rita gave me my 4.00 back and nothing else. No free meal, no gift card for a future meal NOTHING. what a place they steal from you and just don't care. NEVER GO THERE. NEVER USE ALLISON. SHE' S A THIEF.

The spot to go to in Manhasset, food is great or course. No long wait time really. Its an in and out place to eat with family, friends and co workers. Waiters are nice, time to time the managers come out to check on customers- thats rare but nice. Thats why i like this Friday's.

Recently went here with my family. We come here a lot. The service and food is consistently amazing. We tried the new spinach queso appetizer and it was delicious. The waiter was very friendly and was excellent at his job. Keep up the good work!

I come here fairly regularly with my kid.  We were here a couple of weeks ago.  The waiter didn't speak when he took our order.  It was a little odd.  When he came back he explained that he didn't speak before because he had just put a wad of chewing tobacco in his mouth.  He still had the chewing tobacco in his mouth as he was speaking to us.  It was hard to have much of an appetite after that.  We won't be back.

Clean, very polite waiter. Food came fast. My wife mentioned that she wanted half of my burger in exchange for half of hers and the waiter brought the burgers cut down the middle! An overall good experience

I stopped coming here months ago because of lousy service and food. Well had a friend that wanted to come here so I figured I'll give it the old college try and eat here again.  Well once again I'm disappointed and vow never to return.   The restaurant is not very busy at all but yet service once again is terrible.  It seems they have one server per large area and a bartender taking care of tables around the bar.  THIS SYSTEM DOES NOT WORK!!   Whoever thought this was a great idea is clueless about running a restaurant. You can't have a bartender work the bar and take numerous table orders, put more servers on to take care of the table customers along with a bartender to take care of the bar and you won't have the numerous Yelp complaints about your terrible service!   Food is average at best, so there is nothing worth coming back for as for a selection.   I got stuck here the last two times I visited with terrible service and this time was no different, three strikes and I'm out of your establishment forever.
Food was above average, service was very attentive and professional Had the lunch special like this place u can always get great food and great COLD BEER will be back
Had a awesome time at Fridays today! Steve  is an awesome manager and has the place running smoothly. We had a great time. The apps and drinks were fresh, hot, and delicious!

Hostes and server Roni super kind? Food horrible bacon loaded potatoes were burnt and no cheese or bacon, mac and cheese had no cheese at all on top of that the music was super loud I even had to ask to be moved to another area, I love music but this is a restaurant not a lounge, sorry but I will not come back

I came here on Thursday around 1PM and it was not that busy. We were promptly seated at a table around the bar and the host told us our waiter would be with us shortly. We waited at least 15-20 minutes and no one came to take our order or give us water. The bartender was busy around the bar and she came around to us after she noticed that we were waiting for a long time. The food was decent, but the brownie dessert we got, was drowning in chocolate sauce that I didn't even notice there was a brownie in there! When we left, we noticed the waiters/waitresses were standing around doing nothing. They are so lazy, like did no one notice we were sitting at a table waiting for someone to take our orders?

Came and I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich.  I wasn't too thrilled by the sandwich or the onion rings I received.  The waitress was very inattentive as well. The milk for my tea came in a glass which spilled right on table when I poured it..I'll fund a new place this just was not worth it..and I use to love tgis..smh..

Been to this TGI Friday's a couple of times. During my most recent visit, I ordered for pickup and spoke with Giovanni who was very pleasant and filled with so much life! He did a great job taking my order down especially with accommodations to the food I ordered. When I arrived to pick up my order, though there was a little wait, he made sure that everything was perfect. Thank you so much for excellent customer service!
You get what you pay for.  A place where I would only take kids, over McDonalds.  We ordered mozzarella sticks as side, but we got a fried crust without the cheese

I grew up in this area so Fridays was always a go to restaurant for me and my family. It WAS. We asked our server for 4 cups of hot water. She said it would take 20 minutes (it only took 2). Okay then... we then asked for a fork because we received a set without one. We asked the same server TWICE and she still didn't bring it. We had to ask someone else to finally get one. Thirty minutes later(it was that backed up?) we got a salad and a burger. We waited 30 minutes and four appetizers didn't come! We asked the manager, and it turned out that the kitchen didn't even start to prepare a single one! And they did receive the order! The manager paid for the appetizers, but still, incredibly poor service in all areas. It was my childhood restaurant, but I can't see myself coming back after though.

Even though Friday's has always been OK in my books, I think my last visit to this location was some what of a bust. This I'll explain. Yea, the since food is always decent, the host(ess) and wait staff friendly, and it's always fairly quick, I'll always have a soft spot for this restaurant chain mainly because of my past experiences and because of my fondness of their food over most of their competitors. However, at this location, I wish that their staff was more careful and attentive on their clients and what they were discussing the last time I visited. I mean, yea, I still like these guys, don't get me wrong, but if it had been my very first visit, I probably wouldn't come back after the lack of attention given to us. Now, I'll probably give the waitress the benefit of doubt, considering that I could have sworn she was being trained the last time I came to this location several months back, but she needs to be more careful.
I came to friday's on a FRIDAY and they were very rude to us. They did not accommodate my iced tea request. I am overall unsatisfied with the service.
Food was amazing ! Went a few months back with about 6 people . Service was great and the food was excellent . Amazing in comparison to other TGI Friday locations . Definitely going back!

Love Fridays! Their Jack Daniels menu is quite tasty. If you sign up for the Fridays membership (which is free by the way) you can collect points towards free food for future purchases. They will also email you bogo coupons. When I get those in my email I simply can't resist! Everything is already modestly priced so for 2 people it ends up being around $30 including tip tax and drink (depending on what you order obviously) when you use the bogo coupon. The service at this one isn't always great. Sometimes it takes a while for the waitress to get to you. I prefer to drive to the one in Westbury eventhough this one is closer to me. I have never had a bad experience there.

Best One in Long Island.. The others have terrible staff and poor management.. People here are good and actually give you good suggestions. 5 stars! Ask for Calvin! He's the best! Makes you want to only be there when he's there! He makes the 5 stars happen.

My sister just got out of her Winter Concert for the county and she really wanted TGI.  So we decided to go to this one.  Nothing really special about this one.  It reminded me of the Applebee's by my house.  I started taking stars off partially because it was a little on the chilly side indoors and it was kind of dark in there.  Now for the food,  I got the Cajun style shrimp and pasta which was good it was just portioned smaller then I thought.  One more negative thing that may be minor to you but the monitors were relatively far from tables,  I had to squint to see that seahawks vs panthers game.  But besides that I can't complain at all.  I'd suggest going to the Benihana's in Manhasset instead if you're in the area.
It's Friday's what more can you really say? This location is pretty good, get there early enough so you don't have a long wait. Staff is very friendly and the place is pretty clean

Staff has been seeming un-motivated and sluggish in the last few years. Still a great Friday's.  This place has been here forever and delivers pretty consistent food at good prices. The bar is nothing special.

This Fridays is my favorite. The staff is really great, they have great appetizers and seating is always available. I always get jack Daniels flat iron with mash potatoes and for my appetizer the hotttestttt wings! Best meal, thus location surpasses the forest hills and green acres location 100 percent. Parking is convenient and there's great shopping nearby.
Slow service.  It should not take over 45 minutes,  after we are done eating to get the check.  Maybe our waiter went home.  It certainly felt like it.

Excellent food and beverage, good service, nice decor, just if your into sports the TV is not viewable from some angles. Also dust off your seats before sitting as ours had crumbs and other small particles.

HORRIBLE AND DISGUSTING! The minute we walked in we were already appalled.  There was no hostess when we entered, which is understandable if a venue is busy or understaffed; but when the hostess finally appeared we were not greeted and completely ignored. It was so awkward. She then turned around from having her back towards us and asked "three?" We then responded, that we were a party of three, and she just then told us that we could not be seated for another 5 minutes even though there were empty tables galore. Again, I understand being understaffed and busy, but not seating customers is not the answer. A waiter then came over, ignored the hostess and sat us immediately. Our booth was DISGUSTING. There were sticky splatters all over the walls and hair and dirty stuck and scattered within them. I was afraid to touch anything around me. Our waitress was nice, but not attentive at all. She would attend the booth next to ours and did not then check on us. But at least she was polite. Upon leaving, the hostess, again did not acknowledge us at all. HORRIBLE experience at this location. Such a shame. They were so excellent just a few years ago. Do yourself a favor and don't bother stopping here.

Went in for Lunch today.  Seated right away.  Ordered 8.99 lunch with french onion soup fries and french dip. My friend ordered the spinach florentine flatbread with cheeseburger and sweet potato fries.  flatbread was good 25 min later.... room temperature entrees... my fries were limp. soup was lukewarm, my dipping sauce was cold.  Friend's burger patty was warm everything else cold.  ordered Tennessee whiskey cake- joined the stripes program while i was waiting on my lunch - you get app or dessert for free :) - Great dessert! In summary: slow service .... cold food

Yes, Friday's is Friday's. This location was pretty good. Delicious Oreo milkshake that's not too sweet. Juicy burger and ribs. The salted caramel cake was a little bland, though. The service was great, and both the floors and bathrooms were very clean. The menus, however, were a little sticky. Good food for a good price.

Havent been to this locations in awhile, but surprisingly it was just the same.  The service was good and the food was great.  Our waitress was Allison (don't know if she spells it that way) but she was the best.  She always checked on us and made sure we had what we needed.  I would definitely return to this location.

I enjoy going to Fridays, especially  when there is a 20% off or 1 entree free coupon. This restaurant has a large parking lot and is usually fairly busy.  We were greeted and seated promptly, with the host telling the waitress "There is a window table open".  We were seated promptly and menus were brought. Our drink order was taken and drinks were brought promptly.  Our appetizer/soup was brought, and our entrees were brought out promptly.  They had a deal with all you can eat apps, but we did not take advantage of it.  If you are going for drinks, it would be a good deal. The portions were good, not overly huge, and the food was tasty.  My son had the mahi mahi with mashed potatoes and broccoli, which had mushrooms that he didn't plan on,and the broccoli was sort of yellow, not bright green. My husband also had the mahi mahi with potatoes and spinach, which was fine.  I had the ribs and potatoes with cole slaw.          This is a spacious pleasant restaurant, typical chain type, with decent food and prices. It is good for families and a casual dinner. t

It's a shame I have to leave a 1 star it's upsetting their is no negative star option. Garbage frozen reheated food. the only thing worse than food is the service. They didn't bus my table till my main and dessert was finished. They didn't even take my empty glasses. Four glasses in total. Many more negatives just not worth my time to list anymore.

Went here to try out some junk food and the deals they so aggressively advertise on t.v. My first time eating at TGI. Ordered burger and chicken/shrimp sizzler. It also came with two sides. Anyhow the burger was frozen meat with no taste what so ever. Chicken shrimp was decent. I give it 3 stars because the server was great. Staff over all is great. But if you craving decent food/burger few Italian dishes, then is not the place.

Out of all the TGI Fridays this is my fav location. The service and the food is great. I don't mine driving 40mins because they never disappoint you here.. Everything is well organized and the wait time is not long..

Fridays is Fridays, okay? Now that we've established that, we got nachos, a chicken salad sandwich and a burger. Everything was just fine. Good enough for a moderately priced quick dinner.  I wish I got our waitress' name. I got half my sandwich wrapped and she separated the chicken salad from the bread so it wouldn't get soggy. Maybe that's something they're taught, but in all my life of eating out, no waiter has ever had the sense to do this. Thank you for making my next day lunch a little brighter!

I'm not a huge fan of chain restaurants but I've been going to this Friday's a little too often because of all the coupons they send online. (BOGO) This location is my favorite because of the staff, the parking, and the lack of crowd. I'm sure this is because I go on weekdays during the down time. The parking lot is huge.  I normally have a good meal there, but once my meal was undercooked. I told my server, who got me a manager. She was very nice about it, comped my meal, and gave me dessert on the house. She also gave me two coupons for free dessert when I come back.

Standard Friday's food and standard Friday's Flair. After the RIte exam first year, Codrin, Andy, Eric, Robert, Jen and Gabe went to this Friday's to hang out. We showed up and had some snacks and then Ed called. Seems there were a lot of work just piled up and left for the on call person while we were at the RITE exam. Poor ED! Codrin and I went to help him right away. Ah, the olden days.
Nothing crazy special about this place but it is decent and the staff is very friendly... Love the Mudslides also... Definitely get one, even though its winter time spoil yourself l0l

Stay far far away! food was dry, prices went up, floor is sticky, it smells . Went in they messed up our order. I order a water for my son because he can't have sugar. They brought a coke over. I told the water we ordered a water, my son can't have sugar. He brought us back the cup with brownish water. So basically they poured out half the soda and filled with water. Bus boy stood at our table till I was done signing my receipts very upset I might add. It is certainly not the same. Stay far far away.

This is one of my fiance's favorite places to eat.  If it's a busy night the wait is never longer than 15 minutes although you would think otherwise with the amount of people that you see waiting.  It's a big location so plenty of seats especially for big groups.  Starters that we usually choose are boneless hot wings, loaded potato skins, fried mozzarella, warm pretzels with craft beer-cheese dipping sauce or crispy been fries.  I've also tried the loaded skillet chip nachos but they were served to us soggy and cold so they weren't very appetizing.  My fiance only orders the Jack Daniels full rack of ribs with fries.  These are his absolute favorite ribs.  No matter where we go to eat he'll always say TGI Friday ribs are fall of the bone deliciousness.  My orders vary from salad, to as pasta dish, chicken sandwich, a burger or a steak.  Out of the different dishes that I've tried there hasn't been 1 where I didn't enjoy my food.  It's a great place to eat when you want an inexpensive dinner.  The only complaint is that some of servers are really slow and not that attentive.

Fridays wasn't so bad just felt I had to review because of their cheapness, Ordered a cheeseburger wanted to switch from French fries to sweet potato fries did not think it was a big deal get the order there were like 8 sweet potato fries and when I get the bill they charged me $2,00 to make the switch. Hamburger was very good though. Girl friend ordered a half rack of ribs also switched from French fries to mashed why $2 extra don't know felt like it was too much and if you want to be money hungry give a bigger portion, Ribs were also good. Their drinks were good also have a lot of different beers. Very disappointed in their cheapness with portions maybe it's only this Fridays. Next time going to another one.
Having a discount from Optimum is about the only reason why we go there, and the kids love the cup of dirt dessert.
Our debit card was compromised here. No help from the manager.

Our family had the worst experience there by far.  The waiter dumped an entire tall glass of water on me, apologized and left our table. We expected that he, or someone would be back immediately to clean up the puddle of water I was surrounded by, but none did until my husband flagged someone down. Unfortunately they left one part of the floor soaking wet, and when my 5 year old daughter decided to get up from her chair to come over to me, she slipped and fell hard on her back and hit her head.  Of course, she began crying loudly. None came to see what was wrong!  My husband again had to flag someone down to finish drying the floor. After all that had happened you would think they would have taken a substantial amount off the bill as an apology for the HORRENDOUS service, but the waiter handed us the bill with the full amount on it!!!!!!!!   Oh, and of course, the service was slow and the waiter mixed up our orders!!!!!!!!  How do they stay in business!!!!!!!

Fridays is great place to hang and BS with friends at your table, If your not in a rush because the service is slow (and that's being kind) the food is good and combos are interesting. The best long island ice t. Oh and they have take out. Just the food no drinks ;(

The service at this place sucks! It really does. You'll be kept waiting for your food, your check and everything in between. The restaurant is huge and I have only been there when it's not full to capacity, though I know it could get pretty busy, and I have felt like they really forgot about me when I have gone. A Friday's could never get too bad of a rating though because I think the food is awesome. I'm a big fast food person of course, but even my girlfriend who likes less greasy stuff found something she liked a lot (the chicken pecan salad). Brownie sundae is a must.

I've been here a few times and each time I was pleasantly surprised by the food. I'm never thrilled about eating at a corporate chain like this but sometimes I get talked into things like this.  I was with a group and this was their choice, so here it goes.  Came with a party of 7 on a Sunday night. Waited 15 minutes to be seated while the host kept telling us our table was being cleaned. We were sat in the very back corner with 3 or 4 other large, empty tables. Hmmm. As soon as we sat down our server came to take our order. Huh? She decided to get our drinks but left off the lemons we ordered. When I order food I always try to ask for everything I'm going to need when I place my order, like extra ranch, so this way the server isn't running back and forth. Two of us asked several times for extra ranch before and during our meal (because we never received it the first request and someone different brought our food out also without the extra ranch).  I was feeling this was a bad choice but when the food came I was like, wow, this looks really good.  And it was. We started off with the Friday's Combo Appetizer which is boneless wings (but our server allowed us to get the bone in wings, add a point for her),  loaded potato skins and mozzarella sticks. I don't usually like mozzarella sticks but these were the best I've ever had. They were crispy and the cheese was perfectly melted and really good.  For our entrees I had the southern fried chicken sandwich with fries. This chicken was perfectly crisp and loaded with lettuce, tomato, pickles, avocado and cheese. YUM!! It was delicious. My son got the endless apps that were really good and fresh. I really liked that the server put in more than one app order at a time so he had something to eat instead of having to wait to order the next app. (Another point for the server). She also asked the rest of our group if they wanted to order any apps. (Two more points for the server). Two people in our group got the steak and ribs with mashed and vegi and they also enjoyed their food.  For my son and I my bill was $24. Excellent! Good food at good prices.  Plus.... There is a sign when we walked in that says they offer free apps at the bar every Friday 4-7pm. SCORE!  I will definitely be back for that.

My family and I went there this evening and it was a mistake. The service was slow and non response, as I read in other reviews, and the food tonight left all of us with sour stomachs. I ordered the ham, avacodo BLT and my wife the ribs.  You think the BLT would have been a good choice...blah! My wife faired no better with the ribs.  We have been there a believe two other times and we are not impressed.  Thank God we don't plan on going there again.  But unfortunately there are little choices in Manhasset when it comes to "grabbing something quick to eat". The IHop across the way on Northern is just plain disgusting and you can read my post on the Landmark diner....blah! Any suggesting would be great! I

I would NOT recommend anyone going to this TGI Fridays. You're better off going to a diner for late night dining. My boyfriend and I went to TGI Fridays for a quick bite to eat. I work in the industry as well, and I have to say, the service was pretty lousy.  We sat by the bar and was barely greeted by the bartender. He was slow and not the slightest bit attentive to taking our order, checking in on us while we waited, and after we received our food to see if we needed anything. Him and several servers had no problem hanging out and ignoring us and the 2 other parties at the bar.  It took 20+ minutes for the food to arrive, the bar area was filthy and was not cleared for clean utensils. We had to wait long to find him to ask for clean plates and napkins. I ended up getting up and grabbing it myself behind the bar.  Unfortunately, we will not be back. There are other TGI Friday's that run cleaner, smoother and better customer service on Long Island.
Got the big ribs with JD sauce. Great value at $12.99, seasoned fries were good but the new coke slaw they have is absolutely terrible. The ginger lime was much better.
Best part about this place is regardless what day of the week it is the workers and patrons are Convinced it's always Friday. I LOVE IT, I told my kids I want my ashes scattered here

I haven't been to a TGI Fridays since I was a kid. It was blacklisted by my family because my mom had spilled a glass all over the table and it just became a running joke to us that we couldn't go back because they knew what she had done. Oh, the things your family does. On this particular rainy day, I came in with a friend for a quick, time -wasting meal. The waiter was a little flummoxed that I went with a small salad, but there were few options for me as I'm currently on WW and nothing else seemingly fit my dailys.  My friend ordered the jack daniels steak and was for the most part happy with it, but the waiter did forget a side which he brought out when she was practically done. He was apologetic and sincere about it, so no harm done.

Have been to this TGI Fridays many times and it has been very good most of the time. I am a stripes member and my wife and i had come on a Saturday night with our coupon and Friday's stripe card. I had initially ordered a Lava Flow specialty drink which didn't care for and asked to change it to a $5 Long Island Iced Tea special which was very good, much better than my first drink.  Then our complimentary taco chips with salsa came out. This is part of the Stripes rewards. At this point we placed our food order, my wife ordered a cheese burger and I used my coupon for the Bourbon Grill Mahi Mahi which came with garlic spinach with mushrooms and cheddar mashed potatoes. Our meals came out in an acceptable amount of time, the food was hot and very good. You would think ordering Mahi Mahi at Friday's would be just ok but this dish was very good and tasty. Pretty good Friday's!  With all this, sending my drink back and have a coupon which gave us half off our bill, our waiter Ryan was on point, polite and efficient. I found this Friday's in Manhasset to usually be very good better than some others I have been to. We will be back.

To begin, me and my two coworkers went here after a late night of work. We were so excited to have a drink and some apps, only to be denied drinks because they did not accept our ID's... we are all over 21 years old. So we were upset about that. Then, the food was good. However... The silverwear had dried food on it and spots. It was pretty gross so I had to ask for a cup of hot water to wash it off. Then, I went to grab a chip from my artichoke dip and of course there was a hair on it. The service was not that good either because two separate waitresses helped us... the bathrooms were also filthy- a piece of a pipe was sitting under the sink and the toilet paper ROLL was on the floor and the pieces of the toilet paper holder were too. Definitely won't be coming back. When we were given the bill, the manager came over with a coca cola refill(which none of us were drinking). He then apologized, asked us if we needed anything, we said just the check, pulled a bill of out his shirt pocket and handed it to us. Very odd and unprofessional. Never saw the waitress again.

Went there this past Saturday with my mom to get the ribs advertised on TV. Well they tasted pretty good but they were far from the meaty, fall off the bone ribs you see on TV. What bothered me most was watching a server play with her hair, then cough in her hand, play, witty her face then take a drink by the rim and carry it at her side and serve it to a guest.  There was a very nice manager there doing table visits and I mentioned it to her and she said it was probably an empty drink.  I assured her that I watched the server and saw her drop the drink off.  She seemed  You should not touch the rim of the glass then serve it to a guest.   GROSS!  If it was my server, the drink would have gone back!  I most certainly not be doing back there!  Ps there were a lot of servers just hanging around and it felt unprofessional. They could have been cleaning as the place seemed like it could have used a good cleaning.  My server Rachel was great. Hence the 2 stars.

I would have to say I enjoyed my experience here, although the service was just too slow. My boyfriend and I ordered endless apps which was $10.00 each. We both enjoyed it, but it took way too long. There was about 4 tables and it took so long. During the afternoon hours too. Our waitress was super sweet. There was lots of people at the bar and there is a decent amount of parking.

Service was terrible and we never had an actual waiter or waitress during our time here. No refills of drinks at any point, meals were not served correctly and we were never checked in on once. All we got were salads and water and even that took too long as well. Finding our "waitress" for the check was impossible and we had to describe her to a busboy in order to find her. When we asked for a box to go for our food, the waitress was found sitting on the side on her phone and never brought us the box. If you have 2 hours to spend with mediocre service and food, come here.
I went in the men's room to wash my hands and the place is worse than a gas station. Stay away from this pig sty

Went to lunch with my son. The waitress said she would be right over. The hostess was nice enough to get us drinks. After 15 minutes of still waiting we decided to get up and leave. Big mistake, we'll never go back.

Want a quick meal...do not come here.  I don't know where the servers go but they disappear.   Got home late from work, was hungry, decided to drive up the street to Fridays, our dinner was over an hour long. Waited 15 minutes just for water.  Then another 10 for the check after asking.  The food is good and you can't go wrong with unlimited apps. If you have all the time in the world, this is the place to go. If you want a quick meal, I would suggest pizza or Burger King.

I went to this location on a Wednesday night. The place wasn't busy but I decided on Take Out instead. I ordered from their new 4-7-4 deals. I thought that was awesome: get an app for $4, entree for $7 & dessert for $4. The portions are smaller but perfect for a quick bite on the go. The server was rude and walked away before I completed my order. He didn't ask or wait to hear what I wanted to drink.... So I had food with no drink. The food came out pretty quickly (15 mins). Too bad I couldn't eat it b/c my bag of food had no utensils or napkins. When I called the waiter back, he did the same as before and walked away before I got to finish asking him for utensils and hand wipes. When a manager came over and asked me if I was ready to pay, I was finally given good service. The loaded potato skins were delicious. The chicken tenders and fries were cooked perfectly. The brownie obsession was a bit on the hard side but hey! It was $4. All in all, food was great, service: not so much. They need to work on customer service.

Rude hostess & manager. Left because they completely ignored my sister and I and seated the couple who came after us first. Hostess opened the door for us when we arrived so she knew we were there before the couple.

Came here few times and they are very consistent. The service is very slow.... Took almost 10 min for the takeout box and the check... Also the drink had hair in it which they replaced it without any issue. And my entree which was Sizzling Chicken and Shrimp.... somehow there was 1 piece of penned on my plate....my wife had FullRack so clearly this was from either some other plate or was stuck in this plate.... what i dont understand is why they couldnt remove this before handle out the dishes....  The food is always acceptable but the service really need to be change.

I'm currently here with a group of 3 friends where our server was also the bartender.  The room is completely empty with an exception of 3 tables. The bartender was so busy at the bar that he could not be attentive to our table. (Not his fault).  I earned a free dessert with my meal and I had the email. Prior to this visit I would only have to give my phone number and show my email with the redemption. This time the bartender and the manager insisted that I had to have a serial number to redeem it.  They wanted me to download the app, to redeem it through the app for them to even consider it.  Despite all of this mess the food was not even good. The appetizers were sent half cold because the bartender could not be attentive enough. I ordered the cajun chicken and shrimp and it had no taste. I literally ate a few bites.  After years of choosing this location I will no longer come here. The attitude of the managers and failure to work with the situation has completely turned me off. To make matters worse it took almost 20 minutes to get our check. By the way the managers name was Roslyn.

Horribleeeeee!!!!!!!!! Do not go here!! Service is ridiculous!! took 30 mins to be greeted, then 1hr for appetizers that were dished out one by one. Then I had to get up and go to the bar to ask for assistance and ask for the manager. At this point im LIVID! the manager comes and has the balls to dish out excuses as to why this is that and that is this! NO apology at all! it was so disgusting! Worst service I've ever had in my LIFE!  my Fellow diners were talking to me across the tables complaining of the service, this place should be shut down!
Food  was good , bartender took care of us quick , and the food came out fairly quick,  only thing was that waiters were all over the place but over all it was good to eat at

This place is good to get some appetizers. They have a deal now for 5 dollar appetizers which included jack Daniels sliders, boneless wings with jack Daniels sauce, and pretzel sticks with cheese sauce. They also have a special for 10 dollar entrees. The staff is very friendly and are not too pushy for you to order more than what you like. Between me and my girlfriend we spend $40 bucks which included 2 drinks, 2 appetizers and a $10 dollar entree which is not too bad. I would come back here again

I came here on a Thursday night with 3 friends. They have specials on different days and tonight was $3 selective appetizers and drinks. We shared 3 appetizers, an entree each and we were stuffed! We shared a cheesecake too which was pretty good. I'll start off complaining that the food was warm and not hot. It seems like it was sitting around for a while. Appetizers: Fried Green Beans - They were good. Not the best I've had, but I would recommend if you've never had this dish. Tuscan spinach dip - Very solid and safe appetizer. Recommended. BBQ Chicken Flatbread - It was okay, not that great. Flat bread was okay, but it's not good when it's warm. Jack Daniel's Flat Iron Steak - This 8 oz steak was ordered as Medium Rare and it came out as Medium Rare. The outside was not burnt, but cooked to perfection. I highly recommend the steak. Waitress was Phenomenal. Despite reading a lot of reviews about the bad service, our waitress attended to our table very frequently and did a great job being patient with our ordering. There are a lot of spots for parking in the back. Pros: Food was tasty. A lot of good variety. Cons: Food came out warm.

Fridays is one of my favorite places to eat, but I was really upset when I got seated near the bar. At first it wasn't a big deal but then my food came out cold, the burger was not cooked the way I had asked for it, and the waiter was in charge of the bar and being a waiter. The place was not busy at the time so I don't understand why they couldn't have send another waiter. When I was ready to pay I couldn't find the waiter. The people next to us were as well upset that they couldn't find the waiter. I told 2 different waiters who happen to pass by our table if I could get my check and they said yes and I never saw them again. It took me about 40 min to get my check. I was really upset at the poor customer service especially because the place was dead!!

Been coming here atleast once a month for almost two years. Never am issue with the food,but the service can be hit or miss. And more than a few times the entrees have come out not even two minutes after reviving the appetizers;and the staff does nothing about it.
Just like any other TGI Friday's. Food is ok, mostly hit or miss. Place is pretty big so there's hardly a wait for seating on weekends.

We were there earlier this week. My wife ordered a cheeseburger and I ordered unstoppable apps @$10. The burger and fries came out 'cold' and the chicken wings were not wings. When I complained to the waiter he said they were chicken nuggets. I would never order steak and thier menu does not show prices for drinks; we order $4. beers. Safer! We will return, but only to order burgers and to reject them if not hot.

Food was great for a chain. You know what yo expect. Their Jack Daniels menu selections are pretty awesome. We sat at the bar and I gotta say service left a lot to be desired. We got here at 4pm so wasn't a lot of people seated at the bar. Three people passed us without asking what we drinking. Apparently they don't have runners to bus the food out so you end up waiting for them to do multiple tasks.

One star is being nice......service was horrible!  Wanted one of their new burgers...The american....didn't want an item on it that was listed ( a cheese spread) was told by the waitress that that wasn't possible due to it being a specialty burger....really are you kidding me??? And she was a little nasty about it.....we all know if you don't want something on your food you can take it off before it comes out....it's a burger not surgery! Had to ask for lemons for my soda 3 times....asked for when I ordered. ....nvr asked us about dessert...just brought check over....place was dirty too....NEVER AGAIN!

Okay so to start off this is my favorite place to eat. They have everything you can think of there for all ages. My favorite meal there is the Jack Daniels Burger and there is never a wait to sit down the staff is very friendly and the pricing is perfect. Highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Friday's can be either a hit or miss. I've been coming here for 8 years, used to be better. The service has gotten a bit slow, occasionally you get an attentive waiter. As for the food, burgers are always good, the steaks can be chewy sometimes, and the mashed potatoes sometimes come out cold. Desserts always great. Overall I like the atmosphere and the food, but it really depends on the night you go.

After shopping for several hours, two of my friends and I crossed Northern and went for a bite.  We ordered the Sampler, I had a steak, one of my friends had a pasta plate and another had a sandwich...I must admit we were happy with the food; our waitress was a lovely young woman who was so helpful and courteous, and even the dessert was good.  Really, I was so impressed, my expectations are usually lower than low for these types of places, and I am generally happy if I don't get sick at the end of the night, but this time it worked out.   For the price, go eat and prosper...Lol.

This Friday's is horrible. I've been to other Friday chains and they are much better but this one lacks in service so much.  First time I came here, My boyfriend and I ordered an appetizer along with entrees. So, basically they came out together! Worse part was, the waitress wanted to take our entrees back so we could have time to eat our appetizer. I refused! I was worried what would happen to our food while it was waiting...... That same visit, she messed up our bill and didn't even apologize.  The second time, I went to see if this place could redeem themselves; but yet again a disappointment.  We were seated in the far back next to a broken soda machine. It was dingy and dark and smelled really bad. We stayed there though because it was packed and we didn't want to be THOSE customers. (if you know what I mean) The food is sub par. It is basically like an Applebee's with a different twist. I like the pot stickers the most.  This particular location needs new management. Someone needs to whip these young waiters into shape!

I normally go to this tgif for bdays lunch/dinner for my young children. it always been ok, although the drinks are always water down n full of ice, service ok, never impressed...BUT this one particular night, last week, me n my boyfriend decided to hve dinner....boy, was I impress with the waiter named CHAD. He was very attentive from the minute we sat down., drinks were GREAT, appetizer n dinner was on point, extra napkins, didn't had to ask for anything,,,tgif staff can learn a tip or two from him.  hope to hve him as my waiter next visit.
Too noisy and will not go back.  We don't need that music when you are trying to talk to your partner.  As I said I will not go back and neither will my friends

The food was excellent , drinks were great ! But the service was horrible . We got there around 11 and they close at 12 so we expected quick speedy service . It was the complete opposite ! We got drinks with no straws , asked for them twice ! Then appetizers , then our entrees . Our server Tyler was so focused on his already off the clock co-workers at the bar he didn't clear the appetizer plates and nearly burned me with my sizzling entree ! He never asked if we needed refills , or clean plates , nothing . Then it was time for the check . We asked him for it and he said one minute and then went over to the bar to mingle with his co-workers . After 20 mins , we had to ask a bus boy for a check . He signaled our server who then asked someone else to print it ! Needless to say , I left him no tip and left very pissed off !  He spent all his time at the bar and asking what time it was . Very unprofessional .
Very good service, but food wasnt that great, i got the mahi mahi and it was over cooked.

Service here is hit or miss (more miss than hit honestly). 1st time I came here with my friend, the 2 employees at the hostess stand decided to ignore us until their conversation was finished. The food is ok, but I think the wait time is so long that by the time the food does actually come, anything tastes good at that point.

Love this location of fridays. The waiters are always nice and have a great sense of humor. Manager is on tack with checking to see how their customer's are doing. The appetizers are great. Awesome for kids.

Requested  the bar area to get the unlimited $10 appetizers. Greeter stated Im  not sure there is space,  there is  a game going on,  but did seat us there. When we were seated, I looked around and there was plenty of seats in the bar area. The area we sat in had  no wait person assigned,  so we had to wait for the lone bartender who was making drinks for the whole place to finally take the order.  The food was okay, not as tasty as the apps I had in Fridays other locations.  We complained to the manager who apologized and yelled at the bar tender who was doing the best he could,  but did become more attentive.
They were short staffed when we came, but the manager Roberto did an amazing job taking care of us and making sure we had a great time. He definitely gets an A+ for customer service!
Service was slow. Food tasted like it came off a truck and was warmed. Prices were high for what we got. We don't plan on visiting again. So sad it wasn't a better experience.

So I got a 20% off coupon yesterday in my e-mail, so we figured it would be a cool idea to use it at one of our more liked restaurants.  I realize people mainly review to post negative comments, but this was pretty bad. We came in and were seated right away, at an empty restaurant.  Our waitress took ten minutes to get to us and ask for our desired orders, saying she wasn't our waitress, before walking away for another 5 minutes before getting our drinks, at which point we decided on an appetizer. We got the three for all, potato skins, wings, and potstickers, after she told us fried mozzarella was one of only two things other than potato skins, until saying "there's more than three choices" jogged her memory a little. We get our appetizer, and two of the potato skins are small rounded things a third the size of normal.  Shrugging it off, our meals finally arrive.  I get a 6 inch by 3 inch 8 oz. Medium yet somehow completely burnt Flat Iron, two small ice cream scoops of mashed potatoes, and four Parmesan fries.  I ask to see the manager, and instead of going to fetch him she proceeds to spend 5 minutes to converse with some other, freshly seated and very rowdy people. The manager proceeds to tell me the sizes are normal and that she was actually our waitress, blaming it on "no two are alike" akin to Subway, completely refusing to take it off. This was a disappointing meal consisting of a waitress that felt she was right, a refusal to accept something that could have been easily remedied, and a waste of time because of incompetence.  I've eaten here many times and it was a lot better than it was today.
Staff is horrible, slow and unprofessional. Food selection is small too.

2 stars is actually being pretty generous here.  After a traffic filled trip to Long Island, my wife and I were in the area and had about an hour to kill.  Needing a drink, I was pleasantly surprised to see a TGI Friday's right on Northern Blvd.  As an FYI, there's a pretty massive parking lot behind the building.  That was pretty nice. We walked in and were able to snag a table right by the bar.  Unfortunately, one of the bartenders also doubled up as our waitress.  She was pretty busy but also pretty inattentive.  That's not exactly a winning combination.  It took us a while to get our check when we finally wanted to go.  I started out with a Sam Adams on tap - the taps did not taste clean.  I hate that - never a good sign.  For my 2nd beer, I switched over to a different brew hoping these taps didn't taste as bad.  No such luck.  I was pretty disappointed as I love draft beer but I just couldn't do it.   I had to switch over to a bottle - can't deal with the "unfresh" tasting taps.  My wife and I did put in for an order of the pretzel sticks that come with a beer cheese dipping sauce.  I have to give them credit - these pretzel sticks are pretty good.  I've had them a few times now and they are definitely a good appetizer.  If it wasn't for the food tasting pretty on point, I'd probably go with a 1-star rating.  Drinks were a miss but the food was solid.  And, to top it off, this particular Friday's is actually priced noticeably higher than the ones we go to in NJ.

I normally sit at the bar when I visit but last night my friend and I chose to sit at a table. I ordered a grilled chicken Cobb salad and she ordered ribs and fries. I decided to order our drinks and boneless buffalo chicken as a starter. 20 mins later the waitress brings me chicken wings on a bone. I sent them back , finally the right order comes out. My drink shaker was loose and the most of my drink spilled on the table . The waitress didn't care to wipe the table or offer a new one like in the past when it has happened . An hour goes by we still didn't have our entree. IT WAS NOT CROWDED!!! Out of frustration I cancel my salad and told her to just bring my friends food. She asked "oh u didn't get your salad?" I just looked at her. My friend receives her food and we sat at the wet table where the the drink had spilled for the next 40 mins. The waitress never checked on us but one time during the hour wait for food. But the kicker was when she left my bill on the table it wasn't for our table. She wasn't apologetic and never again will I sit at table.
Poor service , not clean at all the floor was dirty where we were seated , as well as the chairs , food is nothing to rave about !

Username: Mr F G And Ms M S.
review: Service was good, we ordered Cajun chicken and shrimp and some burger (2  3 courses meal)..food was good a decent experience..

We visited the restaurant for lunch earlier and too say the least our food was very bad. 3 out of 5 of our meals were poorly cooked. On one of our burgers the patty was raw and cold on the inside. We returned a sandwich with stale bread untouched, and upon so we were asked if we wanted a replacement. Staff was just O.K. Not a pleasurable experience from the T.G.I Fridays chain and not considering visiting again in the future.

I am being extremely nice in giving this place two stars.  I have been here about 20 times in 15 years and it is going down hill.  Not that it was ever great mind you.  Not close.  But usually go once a year or so for the TV coverage for a 1:00 lunch time football Sunday when I have to pick up my son in the area. Anyway, I will say that generally speaking, they make good burgers and their Jack Daniels sauce is fabulous.  As a rule, service is very slow.  These are the norms.  However, every once in a while, they make the big mistake as you can read in some of the one and two star reviews below.   My story of today is that I ordered the Jack Daniels Sampler.  The fried shrimp came out uncooked.  Not undercooked.  Uncooked!  It was ice cold and the shrimps were brown on the inside - not white.  The reason I couldn't tell from the first bite is that the Jack Daniels sauce was very cold as well.  It took two bites for me to figure it out.  So they brought me a new set of shrimp and they happened to bring out another little dip cup of the Jack Daniels sauce and again it was really cold.  So I spoke to the manager and said that I didn't understand the purpose of bringing a dipping sauce that felt about 40 degrees as a dip for a hot dish featuring ribs, chicken tenders and fried shrimp.  What was the point???  The sauce should be room temperature at worst.  The manager advised that yes the sauce was in fact 44 degrees and comes straight from the refrigerator!!  Crazy!  When I commented that I thought this didn't sound like a smart process, he took it to the microwave and had it heated for me which made me feel like I was being a difficult customer but really..........why would they bring 44 degree sauce as standard procedure for a hot dish? Help.  This place needs it.
Been coming to this Friday's for a couple of years now....love that they never have a wait unless its a big game on. THEIR NEW DRINKS SPECIALS TASTE NASTY

Not too Shabby for a Friday's I used to work at a place not too far from this Firday's location and let me tell you, the Friday after work thing freaking was out of control. I never laughed my ass off so much - between the coworkers, the patrons and the servers, all was good. The food is your standard Friday's food- you know what to expect.  All in all though, we never actually had a table (maybe only once) we usually took over the bar and made it our own.  So I can only really attest to the bar area. Huge parking lot in the back.

This Friday's is FAR different from the rest. It's Friday and the staff aren't annoyed with you. The food was fresh and piping hot!! Our waitress was very professional. A plus was the host opening the door for us upon entering and leaving!!!
Bad service. They forgot to bring our water and also forgot one appetizer. Second visit service was also bad. Forgot water . Ordered the tuna appetizer and sent it back because it was brown.
For a Friday's... it's actually nice.  Not shamed to admit I like it here.  (Well, just a little, but not a lot. :-)

MOLD.....Just got back from Friday's in Manhasset celebrating my brothers 21st birthday.   Should be a great experience right?  Ok, first of all the waiter forgot my water like three times of me telling him.  Then he forgot my order and my grandma's order.  He also forgot the appetizer before.  Maybe he was high so no worries, not much to expect from people these days, not like this is a 5 star restaurant.   The worst part of the whole dinner is while my brother was eating he said the burger didn't taste right, looking at the bread he noticed MOLD.  We told the manager and the cook manager also came over and apologized.  Apology was nice but that didn't really make the bread unmoldy.  The manager ended up giving us a 40$ credit which was nice but it doesn't make it a great experience for my brothers 21st birthday.   Horrible experience.  I would have taken a picture but the waiter took the food away.
Very slow service, took 15 minutes to get a drink. WTF? And the place wasn't that busy either. Service is terrible, Our waitress Kate was SLOW!!!!!! How hard is it to take orders?

This TGI is my goto because the other TGI I have been to are all awful. Well except the one on I-Drive in Orlando FL. That was is pretty awesome. The service is pretty good and the food is above average. Zen pot stickers ftw. Their 2 for $20 is always a good choice. There is plenty of parking in the back of the restaurant but come early because they get packed fast.

I've been to various Friday's and this is one of the better locations. Lots of space, large tables and a big bar. The service is pretty good, as the manager can often be found walking around the restaurant checking on people's meals. They try to accomodate whatever needs your group may have even if it means moving around certain parts of the restaurants so everyone in your party can be seated together.  The food is decent. Although it does tend to be on the salty side, but what can you expect from a chain like this? Lots of TV's around to watch the game or whatever's on.

Let me first start off by noting that Danielle here is an atrocious waitress. Not only does she have a negative attitude, but also, demonstrated a lazy work ethic when she refused to serve endless appetizers because it did not tip well and because she did not want to constantly serve the table. Our host Henry, when asked, noted that there were endless apps. Therefore, when we asked our server and she rudely declined, stating "I am the server he is the host", it clearly showed her attitude and demonstrated that she believed she had superiority over the "measly host" who told us there were endless apps. We spoke to Henry once again and he moved us to the bar where Tyler was more than willing to accommodate our requests. My main point is, shall you ever find yourself in the vicinity and eating at this TGI Fridays, make sure you absolutely do not get that waitress and instead request Tyler or any other more competent servers.
Ample parking in the back.  Service was great and fast. Food was standard Friday's food.  Great drinks and desserts.  Nice family & friends restaurant.
